_header: Take the father that Phoebus so bright
_description: George Ripley, alchemical verses on the Ripley scrolls — 40 lines in ten cross-rhymed quatrains

CamFitz276.First Lines:
Take the father that febys so brithThat siette so hey in
                    magisteWythe his bemes that schinyth so britheIn all places were euer
                    that he be…
CamFitz276.Last Lines:
…Some be hinde and some be foreAs philosifeares dothe hime
                    gefe
CamFitz276.Note:
Ten quatrains rhyming abab, in two columns on either side of
                    illustration of the sun; follows 4274.

HunHM30313.First Lines:
[Take thy] father that phebus Soe bright[That] sit so highe in
                    Maiestie…
HunHM30313.Last Lines:
…Sum behinde & some beforeAs philosephers there him
                    gaue
HunHM30313.Note: Second among four items on this scroll.

EDCPRS.First Lines:
Take thy father that febus soe brightethat sites soe hye in
                    magistye…
EDCPRS.Last Lines:
…some be hinde & some beforeas philosophers there him
                    gafe
EDCPRS.Note: Ten quatrains, abab, third verse on roll.
EDCPRS.Editions:
McCallum,  R. I. 
             “The Ripley Scroll of the Royal College of Physicians of
                Edinburgh.” 
             Vesalius
         2:1 (June, 1996): 39-49: 39-46.
